subject: Re: [junit] How to write the assertion?
msgSnippet: ... And this is a good thing.  Because, in my experience, the probability of project success is inversely proportional to the separation between the
messageBody:
On Jan 19, 2006, at 11:31 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> hdpoliya wrote:
>
>> To write test cases with Junit, we have write assertion for the
>> tested
>> method. Then how to write an accurate assertion. Do we have to
>> understand the origin method? If so, then what's the difference
>> between
>> testers and developers?
>
> To write assertions, you need to understand what the method should do.
> You need to understand the results to expect. You do not need to
> understand how those results happen.
>
> In many agile teams, the separation between programmer and tester
> becomes very small over time.

And this is a good thing. Because, in my experience, the probability
of project success is inversely proportional to the separation
between the programmers and the testers.

[snip]

> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
